CFS Checksum Operation

Initialization

Upon initialization CS will initialize its global memory area and proceed to populate its results tables (which are dump only tables) from the default definition tables located in non-volatile memory and are enabled for checksumming. If the default definition tables do not pass table validation, or they are nonexistent, blank definition tables are used from CS's memory and the table is disabled for checksumming. The purpose of loading a blank table from memory is so that another table can be loaded from the ground and be functional. The other purpose of loading a blank table from memory is so that if the table is accidentally enabled for checksumming, the table pointers for the results table point to good data.

Since CS cannot operate without the operating system or the cFE core, CS automatically sets up checksumming for those areas and enables them for checksumming.

The CS application makes no distinction between Power-On and Processor Resets. The same initialization occurs for both types of resets.
